alert.note: Alert for Central Horry; Coastal Georgetown; Coastal Horry; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Northern Horry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 4:54PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Georgetown, southern Horry and southeastern Marion Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Yauhannah, or 8 miles northwest of Murrells Inlet, moving northeast at 30 mph. Additional strong thunderstorms may develop along the sea breeze as it pushes inland. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Occasional to frequent cloud to ground lightning. A quick 1 inch of rainfall in a short period of time. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Myrtle Beach, Conway, Surfside Beach, Myrtle Beach Airport, Socastee, Red Hill, Springmaid Pier, Garden City, Murrells Inlet, Horry, Hickory Grove, Homewood, Horry Georgetown Technical College Conway Campus, Adrian, Nixonville, Barefoot Landing Area Of North Myrtle Beach, Bucksport, Dongola, Burgess and Bucksville. This includes the following highways... SC Highway 31 between mile markers 5 and 21. SC Highway 22 between mile markers 1 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Horry; Coastal Georgetown; Coastal Horry; Inland Georgetown; Marion; Northern Horry
